title: South Carolina Wins Swimming Meet Against Queens
summary: The South Carolina Gamecocks swimming team traveled to Charlotte to compete against Queens in a meet at the start of the new year. The women's team won with a score of 181-78, and the men's team won 156-104. Many swimmers from South Carolina did very well in different races. For example, Amy Riordan won the 100 backstroke, Alexis Dalton won the 100 breaststroke, and Taylor Grimley won the 100 butterfly. Other winners included Emma Reiser in the 1000 freestyle and Kara West in the 50 freestyle. Queens had some wins too, like Abigail Zboran in the 200 freestyle. The meet showed that South Carolina was the stronger team overall, with both men and women performing excellently.

background_read: Swimming meets are sports events where teams compete in races. Swimmers race in different strokes like freestyle, backstroke, breaststroke, and butterfly. Teams earn points based on where their swimmers finish in each race. The team with the most points wins the meet. This article talks about a college swimming competition between South Carolina and Queens.
Article_Structure: WHO: South Carolina Gamecocks and Queens swimming teams
WHAT: A swimming meet where South Carolina won against Queens
WHY: To compete and see which team is better at swimming

perspectives.description: Focuses on how well South Carolina swimmers performed to win the meet.
